Sector: Consumer Software,Consumer Goods,Media and Entertainment,Digital Entertainment,Sustainability,Green Consumer Goods,All Sectors,Social Impact,Impact Investing
Thesis: WE HELP ELITE ATHLETES INVEST IN THE MOST PROMISING START-UPS, ALONGSIDE TOP TIER INVESTORS

Primary Investment Sectors

  • Functional Foods: Foods that have a potentially positive effect on health beyond basic nutrition. Foods that promote optimal health. Includes: Fortified or Enhanced Foods, Minimally Processed Whole Foods. Consuming a perfectly balanced diet at all times is not a realistic behavior for most people. Functional Foods are often an entry point to healthier eating that is more accessible to more people. These foods provide a boost of nutrition for a wide variety of people.
  • Alternative and Preventative Health: Foods and supplements with clinical studies on ingredients and formulations that support health claims. Includes: Clinically Studied Food Formulations, Clinically Studied Ingredients, Clinically Studied Delivery Systems, Medically Tailored Meals, Medically Tailored Groceries and Produce Prescription Programs. In the face of the global epidemic of diet-related chronic disease, millions of people are looking for solutions to prevent, manage and treat illness. People are over-medicated on traditional pharmaceuticals and are desperately looking toward food-based interventions to promote better health and longevity.
  • Food Technologies: New technologies are constantly improving how we produce, preserve, quality control, process, package, distribute and use food. Includes solutions that ensure our food supply is: secure, safe, nutritious, flavorful, economical, convenient and sustainable. Innovations in robotics, processing techniques, and data technology, are creating new growth opportunities in the food industry. Increasing awareness among the health-conscious population is increasing the demand for healthier foods. Rising demand for healthier, cheaper, and safer food products is driving the market for food tech.
  • Regenerative Food Systems: Optimal nutrition starts at where our food is grown. To protect our future health, we must conserve and rehabilitate our food systems. Includes solutions that: strengthen the health and vitality of farm soil, increase plant and wildlife biodiversity, improve the water cycle, enhance ecosystem services, support biosequestration, and end of product-life solutions. With an ever-growing population, we need solutions on how to feed the world for decades to come. Regenerative agricultural practices will become a necessary standard everywhere to preserve the quantities and nutritional quality of our food in the future.


EARLY-STAGE COMPANIES MUST HAVE THESE ATTRIBUTES:

  • Products in the better-for-you food and beverage, health or wellness spaces
  • Demonstrated market solution; potential category leader
  • Scaleable business model led by capable and passionate entrepreneur 
  • Achieved proof of concept, with revenues from $200K-$2MM
  • An addressable market greater than $300MM
  • Pro forma CAGR revenue of 100%-250%
  • Seed or Series A + majority ownership opportunity 
  • Cash flow provides profit optionality within 18 months
  • Comparables model a 6x-10x return in four years 
  • Sustainable competitive advantage and defensible value proposition 
  • Clear path to upstream investment capital and strategic exit

We are happy to have a conversation with budding entrepreneurs, but as a rule, we do not invest in start-ups. In addition to the above criteria, companies should have a TTM of several hundred thousand dollars and a minimum current run rate of $1MM-$2MM.

BACKED is the human-centric venture capital fund. We invest in exceptional founders, at Seed, in Europe.

We provide founders with an extensive support system to catalyse their development as a company operators and leaders. • Seek the Truth • Plant the Flag • Put People First • Keep your Word •

Every founder goes on a radical personal journey.
Especially in the earliest stages of building a successful company. Conviction, charisma and coffee can get you a long way. But the journey can be dark and messy too. And the truth is, most founding teams don’t get the luxury of learning slowly.

Yet when you combine a highly talented founder with the right assistance, there’s few challenges they can’t overcome. We fundamentally believe in supporting a founder’s development from day 1.

At the heart of all this is our Seed to Series A Founder Development Platform, a proprietary bank of masterclasses, tools and service providers for all BACKED founders. Our ambition is to make it the best post-investment support system in Europe. We’re not far off.

Through the platform we assist founders in everything from making their first hires to preparing for their Series A fundraise. As a human-centric fund we focus extra hard on helping founders become effective people leaders. Because we think there’s a correlation between a founder’s ability to scale as a leader, and a company’s growth.

  • Life Changing Potential - They invest in companies that have the potential to fundamentally change the way we live and how we do things
  • Massive Markets with Attainable Targets - Like any investor, they look for products and services in markets that have massive upside opportunities to allow for maximum growth.
  • Strong Founders / Management -  At Makai VC, they believe that the team behind the company is in many ways more important to building a successful business than the product or service itself - so they look for a strong team that is prepared to navigate the challenges of building amazing new companies.
  • Simple Value Proposition - They look for companies that simplify things so that their target customers and investors alike can quickly understand the value they offer.
  • Great Brand Values - They believe that a company's brand can make or break its success. This is why they look to invest in companies that are creating a brand identity that separates them from their competition and helps to effectively tell their story. 
  • New Markets - They are always on the lookout for the next big thing and, when they find new ideas, their team conducts thorough research into the market space to assess the potential to create and scale a massive winner.

We gravitate towards investments in B2B software, data/analytics, and fintech. Our thesis is a combination of opportunity and stage. High-value data, and its infrastructure, creates defensible companies with lower costs of scaling. We typically invest in the “early growth” stage of a company – when there is some revenue and signs of product/market fit, but it is not yet a consensus bet. We like this stage because we excel at driving momentum through targeted BD support, crafting platform strategies powered by core data assets, and preparing a company for growth financing. Our hands-on GPs have a unique ability to identify, underwrite, and support businesses built around high-value data. Our team's experience – working together in this space since 2013 – brings differentiated insights into how data can be leveraged to create value. Entrepreneurs and investors who partner with us find that we hustle, we dig deep, and we make rounds happen.

About Multiplier
------------------
Multiplier was founded in 2011 and we have raised four funds since inception; we have an AUM of $1bn. Our first three funds (Fund I – III) are SBIC funds and our fourth fund (Fund IV) is a non-SBIC fund focused on growth stage companies. Between our two active funds (Fund III and IV) we have over $400mm of dry powder. 

Our Focus Area
------------------
• Broadly Multiplier focuses on technology companies that have recurring or re-occurring business models. My area of focus is B2B enterprise focused tech companies that build and sell mission critical technologies to their customers (“mission critical” defined as companies whose products are hard to rip and replace). 
• Companies must have $5-10mm+ in revenues and must have established a product market fit. 
• The Company should have raised 1-2 rounds of institutional capital 
• The Company can be burning money (in fact 90%+ of all the businesses we look at are investing back in operations and hence have a burn) but the idea is that with our capital the Company has a fully funded plan to breakeven/profitability. 

Our Typical Deal Structure
------------------------------
• Check Size: $5-50mm+ in single or multiple tranches
• Term: 4-5 year terms with 18-24+ months of interest only periods and then level amortization 
• Yield: 14-18% range that includes the Interest Rate and Fees 
• Warrants: 0.5% - 2.0% ownership on a fully diluted ownership
• Covenants: Bespoke per deal but we track the company to the key performing indicators that the BoD tracks

Rethink Impact believes that the next generation of extraordinary companies (in health, environmental sustainability, education, and economic empowerment) will find success through their relentless pursuit of mission, for the benefit of all communities.

  • We seek mission-driven founders and teams leveraging breakthrough innovations in technology for the benefit of people and planet. Our primary focus is on companies with female CEOs, or in some cases, women in C-level roles (e.g. CTO, COO, CRO, or CFO).

  • We look for companies with $500K-$15M in annual recurring revenue that are on a path to grow to $50M-$100M in the next five years (although, we will invest in later-stage deals where we believe we can have a significant impact and where the company is a fit for our mission more broadly).
  • We have a bias towards capital-efficient, software solutions and marketplaces solving critical problems for businesses (B2B and B2B2C) and, ultimately, the communities they serve.
  • We are actively sourcing investments that are making new digital health and education innovations broadly accessible to improve outcomes and reduce costs, providing tools for individuals and families to move up the economic ladder, and speeding the transition to a more sustainable and resource-efficient economy.

We work to actively support our portfolio companies, helping them with everything from their next round of financing to leveraging their mission as a competitive advantage in hiring, growth, and brand building.

Sector: Retail Technology,Financial Markets,Information Technology,Media and Entertainment,Financial Services
Thesis:
Dale Ventures Group of Companies is a forward-thinking venture capital firm dedicated to identifying and nurturing innovative startups poised to disrupt industries and drive exponential growth. With a commitment to fostering entrepreneurship and leveraging cutting-edge technologies, Dale Ventures aims to generate exceptional returns for its investors while contributing to the evolution of industries globally.

Investment Focus:
Dale Ventures focuses on investing in early to growth-stage companies across various sectors including but not limited to:

Technology: We seek out startups leveraging emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain, and IoT to create scalable solutions that address market inefficiencies and transform industries.

Healthcare and Biotechnology: We target companies pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare, biotechnology, and life sciences, with a focus on improving patient outcomes, enhancing access to care, and advancing medical innovation.

Sustainable Innovation: We prioritize investments in companies driving sustainability and environmental responsibility through innovative solutions in renewable energy, resource efficiency, waste management, and sustainable agriculture.

Consumer Products and Services: We look for startups disrupting traditional consumer markets with innovative products, services, and business models that cater to evolving consumer preferences and behaviors.

Investment Criteria:
In evaluating potential investments, Dale Ventures employs a rigorous selection process, considering factors such as:

Market Opportunity: We assess the size, growth potential, and dynamics of the target market, looking for opportunities where startups can capture significant market share and generate sustainable revenue streams.

Team: We place a strong emphasis on the caliber, experience, and track record of the founding team, recognizing that exceptional teams are fundamental to the success of early-stage ventures.

Differentiation and Competitive Advantage: We seek companies with unique value propositions, proprietary technology, or innovative business models that provide a competitive edge and barriers to entry.

Traction and Milestones: We evaluate startups based on their ability to achieve key milestones, demonstrate market traction, and execute on their business plans, indicating strong potential for scalability and growth.

Alignment with Dale Ventures' Values: We prioritize investments in companies that align with our values of innovation, integrity, and social responsibility, and demonstrate a commitment to ethical business practices and sustainability.

Value-Added Approach:
At Dale Ventures, we go beyond providing capital to our portfolio companies, offering strategic guidance, operational support, and access to our extensive network of industry experts, mentors, and partners. We collaborate closely with founders to help them navigate challenges, accelerate growth, and maximize value creation.

We invest in early-stage projects and startups with the potential to significantly impact the tech sector. Our focus areas include innovative software, disruptive technologies, cryptocurrencies, and NFTs. Our team consists of experienced professionals in technology and business, enabling us to make informed investment decisions and support our portfolio companies effectively.

As founders and investors, we get to meet incredible people working on ambitious solutions to everything, from climate change to mental health, longevity, space travel, energy, money, AI and more. Two things we often hear from them is: nobody thinks it's doable and, they need funding. So we decided to solve both by investing in technologies and companies others thinks are impossible.

We look hard for original, defensible ideas that have the potential to become huge. We would rather lose on a bunch of companies than to miss out on one of the big ones.

Focus areas:

  • Outsized returns come from unexpected places
  • Ideas that challenge norms
  • Deep expertise in B2B software
  • Back experienced and known founders early 
  • Back early product market fit 

Anti-focus areas:

  • Generally avoid hard technical and execution problems (excluding known founders)
  • Avoid crowds and established segments
  • Discover trends vs following them
  • Avoid areas where a deep knowledge base already exists

Thesis:
BFV is a venture capital and family office fund that works with innovators and entrepreneurs to address pain points in climate sensitive and resource limited markets in:

  1. clean and efficient energy generation, infrastructure, and storage;
  2. water treatment and conservation;
  3. air quality;
  4. food security and sustainable agriculture;
  5. health care diagnostics and therapeutics.

While many factors can go into the investment decision making process, we think 3 loom largest:

  • Team: We seek diverse teams with complementary skill sets, ideally those with prior entrepreneurial experiences.
  • Market: While the resources space by definition represents multi-$B Total Available Markets, companies must demonstrate a keen understanding of what segments they can address (Served Addressable Markets) and where they will start (Target Markets).
  • Technology: The innovations underlying the companies we invest in must be defensible through a sound intellectual property strategy, combining patents and trade secrets.

I joined World Media Group recently to expand its VC investing after several successful exits for companies that World helped found and/or fund. World Media is a tech operator (Couple.ai, Climb.co, Lawyer.com) and investor based out of the NYC area. World Media invests in companies from pre-seed stage through growth stage, with a focus on pre-seed, seed and Series A entry point investment. We are sector agnostic, though have primarily focused on technology companies. We typically co-invest, but have also led rounds for several of our portfolio companies (like Doctor.com and Sweet.io).

We focus on companies with $3mm to $30mm of run-rate revenue, with year over year growth of 20% to 50%+ depending on size.

We value founders that are cash efficient, scrappy, and pragmatic. We can invest anywhere in the US and abroad. We prefer leading, but can also follow. We like plain-vanilla preferred stock in traditional growth rounds but can also do ‘special situations’ like inside rounds, rushed rounds, bridges, recaps, and restructurings.

Our portfolio is diverse and includes software, marketplaces, and e-commerce.
